alert.note: Alert for Durham; Franklin; Granville; Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 8:52AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham, Franklin, Granville, Orange and Wake. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 852 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen, in addition to the 1 to 2 inches that fell earlier this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Hillsborough, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Wake Forest, Garner, Carrboro, Fuquay-Varina, Butner, Zebulon, Franklinton, Bunn, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville and Knightdale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
